intro: Barongia, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, including Barongia sericea, which is native to southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pink petals. They typically grow in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Barongia species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive appearance and resilience.
